Authors: Hansopaheluwakan S., Polla J.R., Kristiyanto J., Prabowo H., Hamsal M., Lukmanto B.
Title: The influence of social media marketing, website quality, e-wom, and perceived value on the purchase intention (Case study: PT. Vita Nova Atletik's Local Brand Sports Shoes)
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; International Business Program, BINUS Business School International Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Doctor of Research in Management Program, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hansopaheluwakan, S., BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Polla, J.R., BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kristiyanto, J., International Business Program, BINUS Business School International Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prabowo, H., BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hamsal, M., Doctor of Research in Management Program, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukmanto, B., International Business Program, BINUS Business School International Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The Indonesia footwear industry, especially the sports shoes industry, is seen to improve from time to time. The phenomena would inarguably attract more entrepreneurs to enter the industry, since the arising business opportunity seems to prosper. The goal of this study is to determine the influence of Social Media Marketing, Website Quality, E-WOM, and Perceived Value on Purchase Intention of PT. Vita Nova Atletik's local sports shoe brand. The method of analysis used is Multiple Linear Regression Analysis on a distributed online questionnaire. The population of this research is PT. Vita Nova Atletik's social media follower (Instagram), which has obtained 140 samples using purposive sampling. The result of this study shows that Social Media Marketing and Perceived Value have a strong impact on the Purchase Intention of PT. Vita Nova Atletik's local brand sports shoes. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-WOM; Perceived value; Purchase intention; Social media marketing; Website Quality
Index Keywords: Commerce; Electronic assessment; Information management; Linear regression; Purchasing; Sales; Social networking (online); Sports; Websites; Business opportunities; Footwear industry; Method of analysis; Multiple linear regression analysis; Online questionnaire; Purchase intention; Social media marketings; Website quality; Economic and social effects

Authors: Oey E., Wijaya W.A., Hansopaheluwakan S.
Title: Forecasting and aggregate planning application - A case study of a small enterprise in Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Process Management and Benchmarking
Affiliations: International Business and Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oey, E., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, W.A., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hansopaheluwakan, S., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A good and interconnected demand and supply planning (D&SP) is essential for firms, as it will give better allocation of resource and enabler to stay competitive. The basic and simple applications of D&SP are forecasting and aggregate planning which mainly used in big corporations, but less in small and medium enterprises. The research was a case study in a small firm in Indonesia, which started as small and family-owned company, but can enjoy the benefit of simple demand and supply planning to enhance its cost and productivity. Despite main application of D&SP in every production environment, no vast research has been done in the last couple of decades. The study and the case are thus, a refreshment on how application of D&SP still relevant. The case study examined seven common forecasting tools for demand planning side and exercised classical chase and level aggregate planning strategy for the supply planning side. It explored three possible scenarios and recommended a better scenario with 3% cost saving for the company. Copyright © 2020 Inderscience Enterprises Ltd.
Author Keywords: Aggregate planning; D&SP; Demand and supply planning; Demand planning; Forecasting; Indonesia; Small enterprise; Supply planning

Authors: Oey E., Ngudjiharto B., Cyntia W., Natashia M., Hansopaheluwakan S.
Title: Driving process improvement from customer preference with Kansei engineering, SIPA and QFD methods - a case study in an instant concrete manufacturer
Source title: International Journal of Productivity and Quality Management
Affiliations: International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oey, E., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ngudjiharto, B., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cyntia, W., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Natashia, M., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hansopaheluwakan, S., International Business and Management Program, Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Today's competitive market forces companies to continuously seek ways to accommodate customer needs and requirement in their product and process improvement. The study is a case study in an instant concrete manufacturer seeking ways to improve its process in order to win its market share. The study used Kansei engineering approach in capturing what customer's wants. The generated customer attributes were then measured and benchmarked against two competitors. SIPA grid was used to group the attributes into cluster of importance. Based on SIPA grid clustering, house of quality was built, and technical attributes were generated as action plans for improvement. The results recommended the studied company to focus on top five action plans, namely 'computerised system to ensure quality', 'bulk pricing', 'bundle promotion', and '1 × 24 hours on time delivery system'. Copyright © 2020 Inderscience Enterprises Ltd.
Author Keywords: Concrete; Kansei engineering; QFD; Quality function deployment; SIPA
Funding Text 1: The authors would like to thank the anonymous reviewers and the editor for their insightful comments and suggestions.

Title: Analysis of green marketing mix effect on customer satisfaction using 7p approach
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21 Alam Sutera, Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Novela, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21 Alam Sutera, Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia; Novita, Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21 Alam Sutera, Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia; Hansopaheluwakan, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21 Alam Sutera, Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia
Abstract: This study analyses the influence of a green marketing mix method towards customer satisfaction of eco-friendly products in Jakarta, Indonesia. The study focused on beauty and body treatment products. Eight hypotheses were developed to achieve the research objectives by using multiple linear regression to analyse data from 101 respondents in Jakarta using a questionnaire method. The results of this research showed that green marketing mix method have an influence on customer satisfaction simultaneously; people and physical evidence factors were significantly related to customer satisfaction while product, price, promotion, people, and physical evidence were not significantly related to them or only partially related. The results also indicated that physical evidence is the strongest factor, while place has the weakest influence on customer satisfaction among the seven elements of the marketing mix. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Customer satisfaction eco-friendly; Green marketing mix; Green products
